Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Genetic Polymorphisms Affecting Antithrombotic Therapy in Bangladeshi CVD Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomised controlled trial involving 1,000 CVD patients

Participants.evidence: 1,000 CVD patients (782 males, 218 females) at United Hospital, Dhaka, Bangladesh

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the prevalence of genetic polymorphisms

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the prevalence of genetic polymorphisms, measured over the study period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved through computer-generated sequences, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 1,000 CVD patients (782 males, 218 females) at United Hospital, Dhaka, Bangladesh, from March 2017 to November 2018.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Among clopidogrel-treated patients, 64.1% exhibited CYP2C19*2 polymorphism, and 22.7% exhibited CYP2C19*17 polymorphism.
